content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
### Copper Plate Extraction System at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5)
Consists of the extraction burner inserter used to transfer raw copper plates.  
• Burner Inserter at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5) with drop position Position(x=-3.5, y=28.5)

### Copper Cable Factory at Interface around Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
Designed to process copper plates into copper cables.  
• Cable Factory Input Chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)  
• Factory Burner Inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) using direction RIGHT  
• Auxiliary Factory Burner Inserter at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5)  
• Assembling Machine (assembling-machine-1) at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5)

### Belt Depot at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
Serves as an isolated depot for transferring items via transport belt.  
• Depot Wooden Chest at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)  
• Transport Belt Segment at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5) adjacent to the chest  
• Depot Burner Inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) using direction UP

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Belt Connection Target Issue  
 – When connecting transport belts, the target must be an inserter rather than a steam engine. Always add an inserter to serve as the belt’s input target.

• Entity Placement Distance and Inventory  
 – Ensure the player is within the allowed proximity before placing an entity (e.g. wooden chest) to avoid distance errors.  
 – Verify that the required entity exists in the inventory prior to placement to prevent “no <entity> in inventory” errors.

• Variable Reference  
 – Define and correctly reference variables (e.g. ensuring that a target chest variable is set) to avoid NameErrors.
